Eco friendly tours

You can't buy happiness, but you can buy a bike, and that's pretty close. We offer a wide range of exciting self-guided bicycle adventures - in the mountains, by the fjords, and along the coast. Steep hills won’t take your breath away - the spectacular nature will.

Our bicycle tours are designed for people wanting to cycle around Italy - but, eco friendly. The daily stages are moderate, and all trips include luggage transfer.

Please don't hesitate with any questions! Contact us here.

Our Main Tour

(For people 18 y/o and over, as this tour does include alcoholic beverages)

Located in Florence city, our most popular tour will offer you wine tasting and culture in an amazing setting. We meet in the marked spot on the map, and set out on our adventures.

First stop is the legendary bronze fountain of a boar, next up is a beautfiul medieval stone bridge, Ponte Vecchio, overlooking the beautfiul Arno river. We will see sights such as the Palazzo Canigiani and the Fountain of Neptune.

Ride up the hills with us in a labyrinth garden, where we later on (after many more unlisted sights), will end up on a wine-tasting farm with an amazing 3 course dinner.

The Adventure Tour

Located in Florence city, our adventure tour starts in Parco delle Cascine. This tour suits those who likes action.

First stop is the longest down hill in Florence, giving you speed and a nice breeze. The hill will take us to a rafting location, where we will go rafting in an amazing setting.

The rafting will take us to another cycling spot in a forest, where there is a bmx racing track and a grill site. We will bbq sausages, spareribs and more. For those who wants to participate, there will be held a competition at the tracks.

The Family Tour

Located in Florence city, our family tour starts in Porta Al Prato. This tour suits families with little ones, as we have family cargo bikes.

First stop is in a park, where there are lots of wildlife. We can stop and feed some goose, and get some gelato.

After this we will bike thru the old town, where there are lots of catholic churches to see. They have some breathtaking architecture and sculptures. We will end up at a big playground (with the children in mind), where there also is a trampolinepark.
